definition: loose and disorganized soldiers/stragglers/fig. a loner
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
lit. straggling and disbanded soldiers (idiom); fig. disorganized uncoordinated action

sentences.english: The men are preparing their foxholes.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都在準備自己的散兵坑。

sentences.english: Those stragglers and disbanded soldiers surrendered to the government.
sentences.chinese: 那些散兵遊勇向政府投降了。

sentences.english: Lieutenant otts recalled "the best foxhole I ever stayed in."
sentences.chinese: Otts中尉回憶“我所呆過的最好的散兵坑。

sentences.english: It is often cynically said that there are no atheists in foxholes.
sentences.chinese: 很諷刺的是，在散兵坑裏沒有無神論者。

sentences.english: There is no such thing as an atheist in a foxhole.
sentences.chinese: 散兵坑裏不存在無神論者。

sentences.english: Never share a foxhole with anyone braver than yourimmolation.
sentences.chinese: 永遠別跟比你勇敢的戰友呆在同一個散兵坑裏。

sentences.english: Frozen German casualties were removed from their foxholes and Allied troops moved in.
sentences.chinese: 凍僵的德國傷員被擡出散兵坑，他們的戰友再挪進去。

sentences.english: It is not clear how blue stragglers form.
sentences.chinese: 人們並不清楚藍色散兵遊勇形式。

sentences.english: Among brothers, share foxholes, help each other in dire moments.
sentences.chinese: 兄弟間一同使用散兵坑，在危難時刻彼此幫助。

sentences.english: The soldier made a dive for the foxhole .
sentences.chinese: 那個士兵急忙衝向散兵坑。

sentences.english: They are lying silent in their foxholes for they are dead.
sentences.chinese: 他們安靜躺在散兵坑裏，因爲他們都死了。

sentences.english: There was no way we could dig a foxhole.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏沒有辦法可能挖一個大的散兵坑。

sentences.english: I dug a foxhole in the straw and sat watch.
sentences.chinese: 我在稻草裏挖了一個散兵坑，蹲在裏面看情況。

sentences.english: Again back to the foxholes and bunkers.
sentences.chinese: 我們只能返回散兵坑和地堡。

sentences.english: No one had dug trenches or piled up sandbags to protect against the inevitable onslaught.
sentences.chinese: 沒人挖個散兵坑，或是壘些沙包以防不可避免的襲擊。

sentences.english: Three waggons had been attacked and pillaged by stragglers from Davoust's regiment.
sentences.chinese: 有三輛大車被達烏兵團的散兵劫走。

definition: to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
lit. straggling and disbanded soldiers (idiom); fig. disorganized uncoordinated action
ruined army, defeated general (idiom); scattered remnants
